page.title: 08EDUCATION IN TIDWORTH
page.content: Three pre-school playgroups cater for approximately 200 children aged 3 to 5 years,involving them in play and learning activities. The schools are Clarendon Infant School,222 pupils aged 5 to 7; Clarendon Junior School, 250 pupils aged 7 to 11; Zouch Primary School,332 pupils aged 5 to 11. All of these are in Wiltshire. The Hampshire area has the Tidworth Church of England Primary School with 91 pupils aged 5 to 11,also a Nursery Unit for 21 children. The schoolchildren are encouraged to participate in local community work. There is no Secondary Education in Tidworth so the older children attend schools outside this area. Two Army Education Centres help prepare Officers and Soldiers for promotion. They teach languages and, with Salisbury Technical College, provide various evening classes.
